diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Myocarditis, giant-cell myocarditis, necrotizing eosinophilic myocarditis, lupus myocarditis, thrombotic events, microvascular thrombosis.
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with acute severe myocardial dysfunction and clinical features suggesting myocyte necrosis. Initial assessments ruled out acute coronary syndrome due to normal epicardial coronary arteries. Elevated troponin I levels, echocardiographic findings of severe biventricular dysfunction, and a myocardial biopsy confirming ischemic microvascular injury led to the diagnosis of C-APLAS.
